Pratibha syntex is a large vertically integrated, sustainability oriented supplier of knitted textile products. Engineering a new business paradigm, the company streamlines the production from fiber to garment to reflect emerging sustainable values in textiles and fashion. Driven by a strong progressive vision, pratibha is committed to creating relationships across the value chain bringing together 25,000 farmers, 6500 employees, and renowned global apparel brands from over 40 countries. ?? cotton: pratibha’s organic farming project - vasudha is one of the largest of its kind. Engaging 25,000 farmers over 130,000 acres, 22,000 tonnes of organic, regenerative, fairtrade cotton is produced every year. ?? yarns: state-of-the-art facility manufactures 20,000 tonnes ring spun, compact, double, m?lange, airjet and open end yarns – all at one place. ?? fabrics: specializing in a variety of fabrics – single jersey, fleece, rib, pique, etc. Pratibha knits about 10,000 tonnes of open width and tubular fabric every year. Resource efficient fibre and fabric dyeing techniques help creating wide shades, considerate to the environment using cold-pad-batch dyeing & finishing that uses a third of the water and generates half the effluent. Further investment in biological effluent treatment system has completely eliminated the use of chemicals in water treatment and in the process of recycling waste salt from the dye bath. ?? garments: modern and compliant sewing factories are capable of producing 60 million pieces annually. Core products manufactured include underwear, sleepwear, thermals, activewear, fashion tops and knit bottoms.

Seven islands ventures pvt ltd is principally a manufacturer of woven and knitted garments, such as shirts, t-shirts, polo shirts, shorts, chinos, sweatshirts and joggers across men’s, ladies and kids. We have our head office in mumbai and manufacturing facilities in daman, umergaon and tirupur. We take pride in our unique understanding of customer requirements in relation to design, quality, pricing, lead-times and effective communication. All our personnel have extensive experience of working with and for european and us markets. Our company has been in the garment manufacturing business for four decades & we have been the leading supplier to many global fashion brands with long term associations. Our aim is to produce quality garments and provide excellent service / support thereby showing current and potential customers that both our organisation and India can be a reliable and cost effective source of garments. With more than 40 years of experience and expertise in the textile trade in europe, usa, middle east and asia, we are well placed to understand global customer requirements. We offer a basket of products in both woven and knitted fabrics across regular and sustainable versions of prints, dobbies, jacquards, yarn dyed stripes, checks, plains, tencels, twills, oxfords, modals etc all sourced and produced in a wide variety of weights and blends. Our facilities are well equipped to cater to dedicated production of 65-70,000 pieces per month in house and additional 80,000 pieces per month from units controlled by us. Our in-house unit currently has 200 machines in operation and we have an additional 200+ machines from other units. Capacities can be added in-house as required depending on utilization, fairly quickly. Moq’s can start from as little as 400-500 pcs per col/style depending on fabric. Our factories are socially compliant & have sedex & disney certifications.

M/s. Maf clothing private limited was incorporated on 26th november 2008, having its registered office located at adakamaranahalli, makali post, 21st km of tumkur road, bangalore. Maf is into manufacturing readymade garments of casual wear shirts & t-shirts, tops and bottoms, dresses for men, women, boys, girls & kids, in both knits and woven fabrics. Maf also makes ladies inner wares & medical wares like ppe kits, surgical gowns and masks. And exporting to the major markets of the countries like uk, eu, us, au, me & parts of asia. The company is currently operating in 04 locations, with total number of 6500 employees. The operations in bangalore started in april 2009, tirupur division commence in november 2009 and operations in tumkur commenced in october 2014 and kb cross(tiptur) in november 2016. The company manufacturing plant is setup as per lean manufacturing standard. We are equipped to handle all types of bras, panties, semi active wear and other intimate wear garments. Our supply and sourcing is our key strength and we source raw material from all across the world. The company has a very strong quality control team at various stages of the production cycle and also the company works with standardized mills. The company is progressively increasing its in house capacities year on year. Maf clothing is predominantly an apparel manufacturing company that is creating amazing garments with ethical production. With more than 6000 operational machines in three factories, maf clothing is keeping no stone unturned to meet every requirement of the clothing sector in India. The super enthusiastic and innovative designing team at maf are experts at keeping designs modern and fresh. Fashion trends keep changing, therefore maf's biggest priority is on r&d. Intensive research and development is the key to keeping an organization ahead of the curve. It is the team's constant refinement and improvement that helps maf to succeed in the super-competitive fashion industry. Rather than just following existing fashion, we aim to set the trend. We incorporate an innovative mind-set in everything that we create,’ says faizal yunus jaliwala, co-owner, maf clothing. The major factors that differentiate maf from competitors in the industry are its highly competitive pricing, excellent customer service and innovative value-added textile solutions. Along with apparel, the company also has separate lingerie and home furnishing units. Currently, the company has 3500 machines in operation for the woven division (bangalore) and 2500 for the knitting division (tirupur). To maximize efficiency and enable a seamless operation of the plants, each of them is fitted with world-class equipment and technology. The company focuses on rigorous quality control yet it manages to improve its numbers with each passing year. Incorporated in 2009 by a young and dynamic team with rich experience in the international market, maf offers high-grade anti-viral medical wear that meets industry standards. Each of the protect apparel manufactured by the firm is tested and passed through stringent quality tests. Maf follows worldwide recognized test methods during the production process. The medical textile division is equipped with 100 sewing machines, two self-sufficient end-to-end n95 machines and five automatic 3-ply machines. Maf’s wide range of medical textile wear and products include ppe coverall and hazmet suit, n 95 masks, protective gowns, protective gloves and face shields. To maximize efficiency and enable a seamless operation of the plants, each of our plants is fitted with world-class equipment and technology. With the success of the past years and strong relationship with its overseas customers, the company has been able to grow the business to a good level in the present competitive market. Company achieved turnover of over rs. 400 Crores before covid 19 pandemic. And in spite of the hard time during pandemic it achieved a turnover of over 350 crores. And in the last financial year company achieved turnover of over rs. 500 Crores. Currently, the company is aiming to achieve an annual turnover of 750cr by the end of 2025 and 1000cr by the end of 2030. Working towards the best interests of the clients, maf clothing keeps on doing constant research on fabric designs and quality.

Shree renga polymers Shree renga polymers is a frontrunner in pet bottle recycling and sustainable textiles in India. Founded by mr. K. Sankar back in 2008, his constant quest for innovation and tech-savvy solutions in recycling polymer products have evolved the company into a pre-eminent force in the realm. We are located in the tranquil city of karur known for its home textile industries, bus body building and mosquito nets. We are a unique industry in this geography and are advantaged by the proximity to the market both on the sales and procurement. Shreerengapolymers We have cutting edge german technology powering our production lines with exemplary quality and efficient productivity. The hallmark of our technology is in manufacturing dope dyed colours and speciality recycled polyester fibers. We have developed more than 50 colours in a short span of time and have capabilities to produce flame retardant, anti microbial, tri-lobal and hollow fibers. Our unique selling proposition is the ability to manufacture colourants and masterbatches in-house for the dope dyed processing. We have the unmatched ability to match the precise colour requirements of our customers. This has given us a great advantage in the market place and creates the moat around our business. We attribute the success of our company to the unending fascination and passion exhibited by mr. K sankar. Driven by his obsession for polymer products and green field projects, he pursued post graduate studies in polymer technology at the revered Indian institute of technology, new delhi. Through years of intense work experience with polymers products of diverse kinds, mr. K sankar has absorbed hands-on expertise with range of products that include pet fibres, frp products, synthetic marble, white goods plastic components, textile plastic components, nylon compounds, pet engineering plastics, and the like. Shree renga polymers constantly strives to upgrade our quality of product and service with the deepest insights shared by mr. Sankar which he has acquired through decades of experience in recycling engineering plastics. As an integral part of our product development processes, he guides the progress end-to-end right from conceptualization until final completion. Following the footsteps of his father, today, mr. Senthil sankar preserves the service and product excellence and optimizes the brand with his innate business acumen. His next-gen ideas and contemporary perceptions navigate the company in a more progressive pathway where novel products are created to cater to present-day challenges. His promising academic background with a mechanical engineering degree from vellore institute of technology and executive education from Indian institute of management, ahmedabad coupled with industry experience working with the tata group of companies as mechanical engineer add reasons to his competitive calibre.

Valiance world: redefining men's elegance Welcome to the epitome of men's fashion – valiance world, where sophistication meets craftsmanship. With a rich legacy of over two decades in the textile industry, valiance world seamlessly transitioned to the creation of valiance drip – an unparalleled brand synonymous with premium men's wear. Our commitment to quality and affordability became the keystones of our enterprise. Today, we proudly extend this legacy to valiance drip – a brand that embodies the essence of men's premium fashion. Unveiling valiance drip: valiance drip, our exclusive men's fashion brand, is not just clothing; it's an art form. We take pride in presenting a collection that transcends mere attire – it's an expression of individuality, style, and confidence. Valiance drip stands as a testament to our evolution, where each piece is carefully designed to elevate the modern man's wardrobe. In-house excellence: at the heart of valiance world lies our dedication to crafting perfection in men's premium garments. Our in-house manufacturing facility boasts state-of-the-art machinery and a team of skilled artisans. Every creation, from the conceptualization to the final product, is meticulously nurtured within our creative haven. This is where textile meets art, and garments become an extension of one's personality. The power of precision: our commitment goes beyond fashion; it's a dedication to precision. Valiance world orchestrates a seamless supply chain, ensuring that each premium garment reflects our unwavering standards. With a keen focus on timely deliveries, ethical practices, and sustainability, we redefine what it means to dress in style. Sustainability and customer satisfaction: valiance world is committed to crafting not just garments but a sustainable future. From responsible sourcing to eco-friendly practices, we ensure that every thread tells a story of environmental consciousness. Customer satisfaction is not just a goal; it's our commitment. We believe in crafting experiences that go beyond the seams of our garments. Manufacturing excellence for global markets: valiance world takes pride in offering manufacturing services that cater to global standards. Our commitment to timely deliveries ensures that your orders reach you precisely when you need them. Moreover, our in-house manufacturing allows us to provide cost-effective solutions without compromising on quality. We understand the importance of keeping production costs reasonable, making valiance world your ideal partner for any manufacturing or white labelling services. Harmony: valiance world is more than a brand; it's a family. Our commitment to harmony towards workers is reflected in fair labor practices, ensuring that every artisan involved in the creation of our garments is treated with respect and dignity. We believe that a harmonious workplace contributes to the creation of garments that carry positive energy. Valiance world at iigf (India international garment fair): this year, valiance world invites you to experience the pinnacle of men's fashion at the iigf. Our pavilion will showcase the finest from valiance drip – a collection that captures the essence of contemporary elegance. Join us as we redefine the standards of men's premium wear, blending sophistication with comfort. Join the valiance movement: beyond the stitches and fabrics, valiance world is a movement – a celebration of men's elegance. Join us at iigf, delhi, and immerse yourself in a world where each garment is a masterpiece. Our commitment is not just to fashion but to an elevated way of living – welcome to the valiance world. At valiance world, we craft not just garments but narratives of confidence, style, and individuality. Step into a world where each thread speaks the language of premium elegance – welcome to valiance world.

Sustainable cotton is therefore grown in a Way that can maintain levels of production with Minimal environmental impact. Why eco friendly fabrics? The type of fabric used to make your t shirt or pair of eco friendly Socks will determine how much environmental degradation it ends up Causing — or the practices that reverse it. Think about it: fabric choice directly affects the raw material sourcing (Farming and petroleum drilling impact), material processing (chemicals Needed to turn it into fiber), and end-of-life prospects (ways a garment Can be disposed) like can it be recycled or composted? That pair of bamboo-viscose socks is not so innocuous after all… We weren’t the first to say it and we won’t be the last. When it comes to pollution, the fashion industry is One of the largest contributors in the world. Not only does it pollute, but the materials that make up the fabrics used Directly impacts and contributes to: consumption of water, microplastic Pollution, greenhouse gas emissions, soil degradation, rainforest Destruction and lastly landfill waste of epic proportions. You probably wouldn’t be wrong for thinking that sustainable and ethical Fashion starts with fabric. On the positive side, environmentally friendly fabrics are easy (mostly) to Find — if you know where to look. And the brands that use them are Staking their claim for a better fashion future. One that’s good for people and the planet. Why eco friendly fabrics? INTERLINING: THE SOUL OF ANY GARMENT Interlining is the soul of every garment: it makes garments long-lasting, improving the fabric?s performance and giving it structure. Ozonator for water & chemical free indigo discharge process. Recognized industrial zone midc tarapur, maharashtra. We have all local, state & national permissions with respect to all the govt. Departments. Balavigna weaving mills an iso 9001:2015, sa 8000 certified company has earned the prestigious global organic textile standard (gots), 5s japanese award and various other awards. For close to three decades, we balavigna weaving mills, have woven excellent fabrics comprising organic cotton and blended materials. We were incorporated in the year 1995 and have been involved in textile manufacturing adapting fast to the changing fashion trends. At, balavigna we believe in imparting quality for product perfection. We are accredited with the following yarn : cotton, polyster, modal, excel, slub, organic cotton, lycra cotton/ polyster Balavigna is a name to reckon in market in India and abroad. We are primarily known and recognized as the "lycra people " because of the high quality lycra we supply. We manufacture and sale 100% superior quality cotton & blended lycra cored stretch fabrics. We specialize in lycra cored stretch fabrics in various blends. We employ the best state-of-the-art textile machinery. In an endeavor to provide the best , our fabrics undergo a strict supervision and the scrutiny by sophisticated testing equipments and machines. Use of the best machines like 211 air jet, sulzer, projectile rapier looms. Our yarns are accredited by the most prestigious certificates like lycra, control union certifications, coolmax, eko sustainable textiles, dow, xla, birla cellulose modal. Infrastructure Balavigna weaving mills pvt. Ltd., Occupies a spacious area of 85,000 sq.Ft of land under a pillar less shed. Our infrastructure comprises warehouse, stores, quality control lab, modern warp tying machine and generator section for non stop production. Our weaving house is equipped with high quality updated machines like sulzer a9500, sultex l5500, dornier awv8/s, toyota jat710, rifa, airjet looms,modern sulzer p7100 projectile shuttle less dobby weaving machines capable of producing premium quality fabrics up to 365cms width in weaves like plain, twill, drill, satin gabardine, oxford, matty & all dobby designs up to 20 shafts etc. According to market demand. All our looms are connected to online ?loom data? monitoring systems. Quality assurance Our success lies in " quality with commitment ". We have been awarded the iso 9001:2015 & 5s japanese system certification identifying our quality work.We have well equipped factories covering small and bulk manufacturing with sound infrastructure. Orientated towards achieving desired results, balavigna works with a highly professional approach, while maintaining ethical business practices. The group manages a synergy with its clients for mutual growth. At present, balavigna products to the discerning markets all across the globe. Export market Our linen and lycra fabrics are exported to usa, europe, sri-lanka and egypt. Home textiles are exported to united states of america, europe and japan. Other finished fabrics are exported to uk, sri-lanka, dubai, europe and usa Home textile Our company manufactures a wide range of home linen and institutional linen products. We use good quality, breathable and skin-friendly fabric to make all our home textile products. Our collection is available in exquisite colours, designs and patterns. Home textile linen products At balavigna, we have expanded our production capability to produce a complete range of home textiles products such as bed, bath, table and kitchen linen. We manufacture 100% cotton, poly cotton and linen/cotton. Our products include solid and yarn dyes in jacquards apart from the regular percale and satin. According to client specification we can also do embellishments, embroidery and printing on the home textiles. Institutional linen products We offer white cotton bedsheets, poly cotton bedsheets, pillow covers, fleece blankets, hospital gowns and mortuary sheets. All the products find application in nursing homes, hospitals and clinics. We also manufacture a wide variety of hospitality linen. The range finds application in hotels, motels and guest houses. We offer bedsheets, pillow cases, bed spreads, blankets, shower curtains, mattress covers, table linen, bathroom linen (towels, face napkins, bath mats) and many more products. Yarns From our group, we have started our own yarn agency division in the name of ?balavigna yarn division? where we are intending yarns for direct exports of yarn / fabrics to china, bangladesh, south america & iran Inland corporates and domestic weavers in both weaving and knitting. Our main activity is sourcing and supplying of different type of yarns. Thus bridging the gap between manufacturers and customers. We firmly believe in long term relationship with our suppliers and customers by providing sincere and prompt service. We lay special emphasis on price, quality and on time delivery. Our success is solely on our supplier's and our customer's success.

SIPCOT - STATE INDUSTRIES PROMOTION CORPORATION OF TAMIL NADU LTD.

With the objective to promote industrial growth in tamil nadu, state industries promotion corporation of tamil nadu limited (sipcot) was established in 1971. Since its inception, sipcot has nurtured the development of 30 industrial parks including 6 sezs, across the state in a total extent of about 38,500+ acres. Sipcot industrial parks are provided with basic infrastructure facilities comprising well-connected and well-lit road network with storm water drainage systems, water supply distribution and storage systems, fully functional administrative offices, robust park surveillance systems, adequate green cover development and well-maintained open space reservation (osr) areas ensuring the right balance between industry and environment. Over the last 53 years, sipcot has been instrumental to the establishment and growth of 3,100+ industrial units with a cumulative investment of about rs.1.6+ Lakh crore generating 7.5+ Lakh employment opportunities. In the 21st century, the industry 4.0 Revolution has resulted in the significant transformation of manufacturing processes. With the advancement towards smart factories and artificial intelligence technologies, the requirements of industrial infrastructure have significantly changed from basic to comprehensive infrastructure facilities. Sipcot always endeavours to facilitate a comprehensive industrial ecosystem catering to the emerging needs of industries. In the recent years, sipcot had embarked on a journey of promoting emerging sectors in the state viz. Furniture, medical devices, electronic manufacturing, food processing, future mobility, textile & leather, through its sector specific parks which are envisaged to be the crown jewels of industrial growth in tamil nadu. Sipcot has prepared comprehensive industrial park master plans through reputed technical and management consultants with detailed zoning and phasing based on the needs of sector-specific industries. Through its sector specific parks, sipcot aims to provide the benefits of the economies of scale with a shared ecosystem for various stakeholders in the value chain. Sipcot has transformed its business facilitation services with increased focus on e-initiatives including digitization of files, use of e-office system and user-friendly gis portal for investors to know information about various industrial parks and land availability. The online land allotment application portal has continued to serve the applicants in a seamless and transparent manner. Sipcot has adopted flexible plot sizing practices, periodic plot utilization checks, surrender and sub-leasing policies to ensure efficient use of allotted plot by the allottees. Sipcot has proposed to create a land bank of 45,000 acres over a period of five years, including its upcoming industrial parks and proposed industrial parks, to cater to the demand of the prospective investors/entrepreneurs. This land bank will be created with major focus on industrially backward districts. Sipcot?s private negotiation practice has quickened the land acquisition process. Inclusive and sustainable industrial development has always been the priority of sipcot. Through participatory infrastructure development program for upgradation and providing specialized infrastructure facilities, sipcot endeavours to inculcate the sense of collective responsibility among the allottees of its industrial parks. Sipcot is transforming its industrial parks into greener, environment friendly and sustainable ecosystems through its green initiatives viz., Reuse of wastewater, rejuvenation of water bodies and massive avenue plantations to create carbon sinks.

Dyers association of tirupur (dat) is an industry association registered under tamil nadu societies registration act,1975. It is catering to the needs of its member dyeing units 459 mostly msme units. It indulges in policy advocacy and represent to the government on behalf of its members. At the initiative of dat, world's first zero liquid discharge (zld) system was developed by tirupur dyers and successfully implemented in all 18 common effluent treatment plants (cetps) and individual effluent treatment plants (ietps) since 2012. Zld system facilitates prevention of water pollution and recycling of water to the tune of 12 crore litre daily. Thus the dyeing industry daily saves 12 crore litre avoiding utilisation of underground water. Due to reuse of recycled water by the dyeing units, offtake of water from 3rd water scheme has reduced considerably. They take water only to top up the gap of 5% to 10% since the remaining requirement is fulfilled by the recycled water. The industry's unutilised water is now available to the general public and water scarcity is minimised.

Amiha agro pvt. Ltd.: Leading the sustainable cotton revolution Introduction: in an era where sustainability transcends buzzwords to become a core business ethos, amiha agro pvt. Ltd. Emerges as a pioneering force in the realm of sustainable cotton production. With a rich legacy of 25 years, amiha agro stands as a beacon of environmental stewardship, community empowerment, and innovation in agriculture. This profile delves into the company's transformative journey, unparalleled initiatives, and unwavering commitment to shaping a sustainable future. Foundations of sustainability: at the heart of amiha agro's mission lies an unwavering commitment to sustainability. Recognizing the environmental implications of conventional cotton farming, amiha agro embarked on a mission to revolutionize the industry through responsible practices. From the outset, the company prioritized eco-friendly farming techniques, setting new benchmarks for environmental responsibility. Trailblazing initiatives: 1. organic cotton production: amiha agro takes immense pride in pioneering organic cotton production in India. With a legacy spanning over two decades, the company has been instrumental in advancing organic farming practices, fostering biodiversity, and reducing the ecological footprint of cotton cultivation. 2. collaboration with global brands: in a groundbreaking move, amiha agro has forged strategic partnerships with leading global textile brands. By establishing direct relationships between farmers and brands, the company has streamlined the supply chain, ensuring fair compensation for farmers and enabling brands to source sustainable cotton with confidence. 3. certification and recognition: amiha agro's commitment to sustainability is underscored by prestigious certifications, including the coveted regen-agri certification. This recognition not only validates the company's adherence to regenerative agricultural practices but also underscores its commitment to fostering resilience in ecosystems. Empowering communities: 1. engagement with farmers: central to amiha agro's success is its association with 85,000 farmers who share the company's vision for a sustainable future. Through capacity-building initiatives, training programs, and knowledge-sharing sessions, amiha agro empowers farmers to adopt sustainable farming practices, thereby enhancing productivity and livelihoods. 2. women and child empowerment: recognizing the critical roles played by women and children in farming communities, amiha agro has implemented targeted programs aimed at enhancing their capabilities and providing access to new opportunities beyond agriculture. These initiatives reflect the company's holistic approach to community development, fostering inclusivity and gender equality. Transparency and traceability: 1. transparent supply chain: amiha agro places transparency at the forefront of its operations, providing stakeholders with complete visibility into the production process. By disclosing information on farming practices, environmental impact, and fair compensation, the company sets industry standards for transparency and ethical conduct. 2. traceable trade practices: through yd traceability systems, amiha agro ensures the authenticity of its sustainable cotton products. Stakeholders can access comprehensive information on each participant in the supply chain, fostering accountability and enabling informed choices. Environmental stewardship: 1. water conservation: recognizing the importance of water conservation, amiha agro has implemented innovative techniques to optimize water usage in cotton cultivation. These initiatives reflect the company's commitment to responsible resource management and environmental sustainability. 2. biodiversity preservation: amiha agro's sustainable farming practices prioritize biodiversity preservation, creating habitats for diverse species and fostering ecological resilience. These efforts underscore the company's holistic approach to environmental stewardship, integrating biodiversity conservation into its core business practices. Conclusion: in conclusion, amiha agro pvt. Ltd. Stands as a trailblazer in sustainable cotton production, setting new benchmarks for environmental responsibility, community empowerment, and ethical business conduct. With a rich legacy of innovation and a steadfast commitment to sustainability, amiha agro is shaping the future of the textile industry, one sustainable thread at a time. As the company continues to cultivate a legacy of positive change, it invites stakeholders to join hands in building a more sustainable, transparent, and equitable future for all.

column1: Having started operations in the year 1964, in guntur, andhra pradesh, India, we at nrkr textiles have evolved leaps and bound over the years as we have reached milestones after milestones therefore evolving to be known as pioneers in textile industry. Indeed we have woven a remarkable success story together. Founded by sri nrkr, his vision made him a pioneer cotton ginner in the state and his style of procurement is heard even today in the cotton farming community especially for his generosity towards the farmer. Seeing the need for transporting processed cotton to long distances, sri. Nrkr established and ran the first cotton pressing factory in the state. Nrkr, our chairman, added the spinning vertical in 1991 by acquiring a mill in salem, tamilnadu. His efficiency to run an industry made him take up very big and established spinning mills in India on lease basis until he setup his own 25,000 spindle mill in rajahmundry ( unit-1) followed by chebrole. The need of the hour’ state of the art infrastructure Today the company houses more than 500 employees and is a key player in the global market as we have been contributing earnestly to the growing textile industry. With an aggregated capacity of 100000 spindles geared up with 100 cotton gins, nrkr textiles is in the process of adding 35000 spindles and 100 air jet looms to its existing capacity. And so, with state of the art infrastructure, we have been passionately performing to meet the huge requirement each day.

About India itme society India itme society established as a nonprofit industry body in 1980, today is the backbone of textile engineering industry & the best catalyst for technological excellence weaving success stories for textile & textile engineering industry not only in India but across the globe. India itme society is unique in its kind of exhibitions, as it strengthens the industry by escalating textile manufacturing, supporting in building avant-grade manufacturing infrastructure by technology up-gradation, fostering innovation, facilitating exchange of knowledge & encouraging foreign direct investments and joint ventures without compromising on enhancing on skills & traditional skills of hand-woven sector. Today, the events by India itme society are acknowledged globally not only by textile & textile engineering industry but also have become landmark events and a pride for India. India itme society organizes exhibitions every year, addressing different requirements of the industry segment under its banner. 1. India international textile machinery exhibition (India itme) - flagship event since 1980 completing 43 years) 2. Global textile technology & engineering show (gttes) - focused on sme sector and regional hubs) 3. International technology, machinery & engineering exhibition (itme africa) (overseas edition). India itme society also promotes education, technology research, knowledge dissemination through various programs under its umbrella and holds close affiliations with organizations / associations across globe with similar objectives. India itme society is a trend setter for out of box ideas in serving the industry members, not limited to India, but in africa and other frontiers. Humility of action, integrity of purpose and transparency of conduct are the key traits driving the society journey forward.

Our business 'arun electronics' was established in the year 1985. Initially, we started manufacturing plastic knobs, monograms and precision components for the tv industry and supplied these components to most of the Indian reputed brands. In the year 2000, we had an opportunity to make precision components for electricity energy meters from engineering plastic material. Soon after, in the year 2002, we came to know about plastic seal tags and we took it as another opportunity. It was a big challenge and opportunity at the same time as no one had ever manufactured this product in the country before. We were the first to introduce the 'plastic seal tag' in the Indian market. With the success of the seal tags, we started manufacturing other plastic and rubber products such as plastic hang tags, plastic monograms, rubber & pu labels, tag seal, tag dori, dori tag, sample sealers & security seals. These items are used in many consumer products such as readymade garments, suits, ethnic wear, wrist watches, home decor, jewellery, ties, handbags, luggage, sunglasses, footwear, sportswear and so on. One can use it with any type of consumer product to enhance its brand value. We have been producing the best quality products with sheer commitment of time for more than 15 years for the Indian garment industry and even Indian garment exporters.

Reliance industries limited (ril), established by shri dhirubhai h. Ambani over four decades ago, is India's leading private sector enterprise. Its diverse operations encompass hydrocarbon exploration and production, petroleum refining and marketing, petrochemicals, advanced materials, renewables (solar and hydrogen), financial services, retail, and digital services. A significant player in the global integrated energy value chain, ril achieved a consolidated revenue of ? 9,74,864 crore ($118.6 Billion), cash profit of ? 1,25,951 ($ 15.3 Billion) and a net profit of ? 73,670 crore ($9.0 Billion) during fy 2022-23. Ranked 88th globally, reliance holds the distinction of being the largest private sector company from India featured in fortune's "world's largest companies" list for 2023. In the forbes global 2000 rankings for 2023, it stands at the 45th position, the highest among Indian companies. Forbes recognized reliance among the world's top 20 companies to work for and as the leading Indian company in its world's best employers list for 2022. The company also made it to linkedin's list of "top companies 2023: the 25 best workplaces to grow your career in India." Ril's oil to chemicals (o2c) business is renowned for its globally integrated petrochemical facilities, encompassing polymers, polyesters, fiber intermediates, aromatics, elastomers, and advanced materials. Catering to sectors like packaging, agriculture, automotive, housing, and healthcare, ril holds a dominant position among the top 10 global petrochemical producers. The company's plans include investing ?75,000 crore over the next five years to expand capacities across existing and new value chains.

Reid & taylor fabrics are acclaimed for their softness, fall, high wearability, ease of maintenance, and superior shape retention. Similarly, t-shirts, casual trousers, chinos, knits and accessories comprise the premium casual range. Reid & taylor is focused on bringing international concepts to its customers. Founded in 1837, the reid & taylor label carries forward its founder alexander reid’s legacy of impeccable craftsmanship and uncompromising quality, cherished and practiced.

Vardhman textiles limited With a turnover of more than a billion dollars, vardhman is the largest vertically integrated textile manufacturer in India. Annually, we produce 2,90,000 metric tons of yarn and 220 million metres of woven fabric, providing direct employment to over 30,000 people. One thing that has anchored vardhman's growth over six decades of an ever evolving, complex, cyclical and often disruptive business environment is the unwavering pursuit of excellence. This drive to continuously raise the bar and benchmark ourselves to the global best has seen us exceed customer expectations and sharpen our competitive edge. Excellence at vardhman is pervasive across all four - product, process, people practices and sustainable. The secret to this consistent pursuit of excellence lies in a plurality of values, commitment to invest time in articulating and explaining these values to the entire employee spectrum, living these values in day-to-day business decisions and above all, letting them grow strong roots so that they are unshakeable even in the face of adversity. Leadership: Mr. Shri paul oswal is the chairman and managing director of vardhman group. A gold medallist from punjab university, he holds a master's degree in commerce. With more than 5 decades of experience, he has led vardhman to achieve accelerated growth in textile manufacturing. A third-generation entrepreneur and an able custodian of the family business, ms. Suchita oswal jain is associated with the group for over 30 years. She started her career in vardhman as an executive director and gradually worked her way up. Ms. Jain has won several accolades including outstanding women leadership award 2021 conferred by world women leadership congress, asia one’s women empowerment entrepreneur award 2019-20, India csr leadership award 2021, times power icons ludhiana 2021, et leaders of change 2021, et inspiring women leader 2022, iconic leader by outlook business in 2022, apparel resources shero award in 2022 and India csr person of the year award 2023. Our business: Yarn Fabric Garments Acrylic fiber Special steel Yarn: Vardhman is a prime producer and exporter of premium quality yarns across the globe including the most quality-conscious markets of the eu, japan, usa and asia; driven by continuous technological up-gradation, a laser-sharp focus on excellence, customer-driven innovation and effective business strategies rooted in ethics. With a spindle count of about 1.24 Million, vardhman has a production capacity 800 mt per day, to cater to varied demands of customers in terms of both product mix as well as volume. Cutting-edge spinning technology sourced from global leaders strengthens our pursuit of delivering customer delight while a fully integrated value chain offers control over production and quick adaptability to change. We offer the widest range of specialised greige and dyed yarns in cotton, polyester, acrylic, viscose, specialized fibers and a variety of blends. The fibers sourced from domestic and overseas markets are completely aligned with customer's demands and processed keeping traceability in view. Fabric: With 1,550 looms, vardhman has a weaving capacity of 220 million metres and fabric finishing capacity of 175 million metres per annum. Vardhman is one of the few vertically integrated fabric suppliers in India producing fabrics for both tops and bottoms in the apparel segment serving large retailers and most quality conscious markets across the globe. A growth engine, fabrics business contributes to about one-third of the group’s revenue. Product capacity: Solid dyed: annual capacity of 120 million meters. Yarn dyed: annual capacity of 30 million meters. Prints: annual capacity of 25 million meters. Product innovation: Our in-house design team is trained on market successes and failures over the years, to ensure seasonal collections are fresh and innovative in approach and at the same time grounded in market wisdom. Today, approximately 30% of the products we manufacture, are our own creations. Dedicated fabric development centre, with team of specialized engineers in fiber to fabric finishes, enthusiastically works on product feasibility and innovation to keep bringing more on the table. Fibre blends products: 100%Cotton, cotton/polyester, cotton stretch (2 way and 4 way), cotton with celluosic blends i.E. Viscose, modal, tencel, cotton/nylon, cotton/nylon/poly-stretch, organic cotton, recycle cotton, recycle polyester, bci cotton, polyester cellulosic (vicose, tencel, modal, tencel) stretch. Weave: plain, twill, satin, dobby, oxford, and diamond, herrin bone twill, honey comb, 3d crinkle, jacquard, and seer suckers. Finishes: soft, peach, anti-viral, anti-microbial, anti – uv, mosquito repellent, skin care finishes, teflon, enzyme, water repellent, liquid ammonia, airo, brushing, raising & sheering, silk protein, etc. Garments: With a capacity to manufacture over 1.8 Million premium quality shirts annually, vardhman’s garment unit is equipped with world-class machines from japan, germany, usa, china, taiwan and denmark. The garment unit is highly focused on buyer satisfaction for 'quality', 'functionality' and 'comfort' for manufacturing formal & casual shirts. To deliver specially-finished products like post cure shirts, we are backed by liquid ammonia treatment facility and baking machine.

Mud [ muhd ] [ ?????“ ] | noun 1 The earth? 2 The very basis of life - food, textiles and shelter 3 Sanskrit meaning - joy, delight, happiness (not sure) 4 Modern urban design studio (m.U.D ) What better way to wade through life than to live conscious of the endless benefits the earth can provide and what we can do in return to thank it. The very basis of life and living is soil through which we get food, shelter as well as textiles. Before plants and life arrived on land, mud was around. It is one of the earliest substance of earth which became the mere basis of life and also the source which can convert the dead to life. One such essential component is textiles where the fibres are derived from something that grows rather than being synthetically produced. The sustainable advantage of plant-based textiles is that their origin is natural and comes from the earth therefore, more eligible to recirculate in existing ecosystems. India has been the land of such fibre crops and has taught the world to breathe in such textiles. Since time immemorial India has been the land of perfecting such wisdoms through nature, vegetation, rituals, craft, art and culture of living. Apart from growing the fibre crops, dyes and printing also used mud as their main component in ways of natural dyes derived from different plans and also printing techniques like mud resist printing. Mud is an indigenous home decor brand inspired by such ancient wisdoms, crafts and textiles born from the land of India. We wish to return to those wisdoms, that slow pace of living, of making a conscious decision of every little piece that you acquire. Of making sure that it is of such quality that it will be an invaluable addition to your homes and life. Where we ensure that no matter what is created, it is created with time, precision and care.??we wish to create the quintessential heirloom home textiles. ??

The bombay textile research association (btra) was registered by members of the millowners? association, bombay, under the societies registration act, xxi of 1860 on 21st april 1954, with nine mill companies contributing to the memorandum and articles of association.Btra has grown leaps and bounds over the years since its inception in 1954 to meet the technological needs of the Indian textile industry as well as to achieve s&t objectives set at the national level. Btra members include not only textile units (from mill sector as well as decentralised sector) but also manufacturers from man-made fibre, machinery, dyes and chemical auxiliaries industries. The btra zone largely comprised composite mills and from the beginning, the r & d and services were fine-tuned to satisfy their comprehensive requirements. Industrial research is viewed today as a commercial operation to be justified solely by the usefulness of the results to the textile industry. Therefore, the limited resources of btra have been, from the very beginning, efficiently deployed in such areas where maximum benefits accrue to the textile industry. R & d activities at btra cover applied and basic research, process and product development, new and frontier areas of technology, engineering and microprocessor-based instrumentation, operational studies to improve and standardize mill working, testing and consultancy services, maintenance audit, energy conservation and additional energy sources, communication and training, post graduate research and appropriate technology for the decentralised sector. Assistance to the government and public sector institutions on matters related to technological aspects of the industry is also an integral part of its activities.
SYNTHETIC & ART SILK MILLS' RESEARCH ASSOCIATION (SASMIRA)
Sasmira Marg, Worli, , Mumbai 400030 Maharashtra India

Established in 1950, the synthetic & art silk mills' research association (sasmira), approved body of ministry of textiles, goi, has evolved as a leading textile research organization. Over seven decades, sasmira has made seminal contributions in technical textiles, developing contour woven socks for lcas, textile testing equipment, seamless geotextiles, and waterless textile processing technologies. In 2008, it was designated as the center of excellence for agrotextiles (coe-agrotech), marking a notable expansion in its research focus towards integrating textile technology with agricultural advancements.

Sitra is sponsored by the industry and is supported by the ministry of textiles, government of India. Sitra has been designated as a centre of excellence (coe) for medical textiles by the ministry of textiles (mot), govt. Of India. Sitra has set-up a state-of-the art facility for pilot scale manufacturing and quality evaluation of medical textile products. Centre for social markets’ (csm) is a non-profit organisation working to create a more environmentally, socially and economically sustainable society. Through an mou with fairtrade international the fairtrade India project was established to create sustainable agricultural value chains and markets in diverse sectors ranging from food, fashion, textiles, sports and cosmetics. Fairtrade is a global sustainability initiative that aims to protect the environment and empower the farmers and workers who grow and make our food and fashion. Fairtrade works with producers to implement better social and environmental practices and connects these farming communities to businesses committed to greater sustainability. Thus, by connecting brands to farmers fairtrade offers an opportunity for businesses to use trade for change by creating fairtrade labelled products. Fairtrade India hopes to create awareness about the impact our everyday choices have on the lives behind the barcode. Fairtrade India works on a program funded by the european union to promote the united nations sustainable development goal 12 - responsible consumption and production.

We, ps enterprises, express our sincere gratitude to the revered government of India for Allowing us the opportunity to present this pivotal proposal. In the following comprehensive Document, we endeavour to delve deeper into a critical issue that has cast a long shadow over the tapestry of the Indian textile industry the systematic exploitation of weavers and the extensive cost of silk and cotton. This not only exacts severe losses upon these craftspeople but also deters the progress and prosperity of industrialists and the nation. Our proposal aims to address critical issues in the supply chain, including helping weavers recover their rightful revenues and-ensuring industrialists receive top-quality materials at fair rates. Oxley has over seven decades of experience in led technology and is a pioneer in developing night vision lighting suitable for use on military operations with night vision goggles (nvg). We also offer a complete suite of oxley's led lighting solutions, night vision solutions, emi filters, interconnect components and data capturing products. Recently, jindal's has launched first of its kind high capacity 100% natural air cooled stabilizers in collaboration with irem spa of italy, which is one of the world's largest manufacturer of air-cooled stabilizers since over four decades.

Trisvaraa came into being in march 2018. The label Offers some of the finest heritage Indian hand-woven Textiles and beautifully designed hand-embroidered Ensembles. The products are quintessentially Indian in form and Spirit; they are traditional and timeless with a con- Temporary appeal. The idea behind trisvaraa was to Present to the world a different interpretation of our Heritage weaves and intricate and delicate Hand-embroideries of our master weavers and arti- Sans respectively. In aparajita’s words: “trisvaraa cel- Ebrates Indian craftsmanship in its truest form”. As is the story of any new creative beginning there Were many challenges along her journey. Aparajita States that she found a sense of freedom in this com- Petitive and challenging world of luxury fashion. She Says, “i have always been a creative person but i Worked in the corporate sector for many years. How- Ever when career fatigue set in and the boardrooms Did not hold any appeal, i shifted to the world of Design and fashion without any prior experience in This sector. There was always the fear of failing with The added fear of financial losses. It has been an Uphill task to establish my label and bring it to its cur- Rent form. The only thing i started out with was an Innate love for fabrics, textiles, designs and colours And an eye for detail”. Trisvaraa’s focus has always been to use hand-woven Textiles and employ age-old skills of different kinds of Hand-embroidery techniques. In these times of fast Fashion, through her label, she promotes the idea of Sustainable and slow fashion and advises people to Buy less and choose well and to do away with the idea Of wearing a hand-crafted garment only once. Ac- Cording to her, if you choose well, you will surely want to Wear an outfit more than once. The label continuously Strives to maintain the highest standards in quality and Purity with every new collection. A trisvaraa ensemble is A promise of trust and faith. We always try to deliver More than we promise. Trisvaraa is also an endeavour to rekindle our love for Exquisite heritage hand-embroidery which is unfortu- Nately but surely on the decline. Fashion trends influ- Ence the choices of the younger population; however, As they get older, they gravitate towards timeless and Traditional silhouettes. Trends will always be there; but They will always be fleeting, momentary and temporary. On the other hand, the grace and charm of a tradition- Ally hand-crafted garment will always have its own Timeless appeal. However, it is a challenge to keep the Cost of production low when designing a unique com- Pletely hand-embroidered ensemble. Aparajita states: “my designs define me. Establishing My own clothing line has definitely not been an easy Task in today’s world. It requires a lot of hard work and Perseverance and patience. Creating a market space For my creations has not happened in a day. My journey Has just started, and i plan to go a long way. To con- Stantly create new designs is challenging and i would Not have it any other way. I love my work passionately And i thank god for giving me an opportunity to do Something i love doing”. Trisvaraa is for the woman of today who is beautiful, Bold, smart, intelligent and who wants to look her best Every single day of her life. The label is no doubt young And new, but our work is rooted in the ancient art of tra- Ditional handloom weaving and exquisite hand-em- Broidery. The journey so far has been very enriching And gratifying in terms of creative fulfilment. Aparajita Adds: “my designs give me the freedom to express Myself in a way not found anywhere else and i am look- Ing forward to the rest of this journey”.

This was necessary also to stand out of the crowd and tap the niche high-end market. These two enterprising brothers incorporated m/s sudsons woollens (p) ltd. In 1996, to take over the outgoing concern of m/s sudsons which was seeded by the duo, as early as 1976. Sudsons believes weaving is an art and therefore even the minutest details are taken care for all new developments. No-matter how complex, is the design, how difficult is it to weave a particular count of yarn, sudsons accepts the challenge and stands true to its commitment. Sudsons emphasis on top quality product. In its endeavor to better its product quality, its management continuously interacts with all who are involved in various production processes. Established in 2016, luxe living designs, manufactures, and exports exclusive and elevated Indian handcrafted textiles for the global audience. We are a woman owned and woman managed manufacturing export oriented unit based in east India . Supporting over 300 artisans, weavers, and stitchers across three districts in the state of west bengal, we are committed to14 of the 17 un sustainable development goals . In our textiles, we infuse the traditional art of jamdani weaving - which combines intricacy of design and proficiency of hands to produce highly coveted products along with hand-batik , hand-painting,kantha embroidery and tie-dye. All these are produced in the most sustainable production process and are also consumed/ bought as part of the in a similar 'slow fashion' consciousness . The emphasis here is on the consciousness in the production , sale and discarding / upcycling of the product in its lifetime , thus saving carbon and saving the planet in the long run . Our latest endeavour is to incorporate traceability into our produces goods to establish authenticity and highlight the craftsperson. Luxe living currently exports its textiles, apparel, and home linens to chile, italy, japan, spain, and the united states. We are moving into the d2c space with the launch of bonaa , offering all our guilt free , conscious clothing .

Founded in september 2021, paarangat designs is a distinguished exporter and manufacturer specializing in hand-embroidered ready-made garments for ladies and kids. With a commitment to excellence and an eye for intricate craftsmanship, we bring forth a unique collection of hand-embroidered woven garments that exude elegance, style, and artistry. At paarangat designs, we understand the significance of fashion in expressing individuality, and our garments are a reflection of this philosophy. Each piece is meticulously crafted by skilled artisans who possess an innate passion for embroidery and a deep appreciation for the rich cultural heritage that inspires their work. Our range of ladies' and kids' ready-made garments is designed to cater to the discerning tastes of fashion-conscious individuals who seek exquisite clothing that seamlessly blends tradition with contemporary aesthetics. Uniforms unlimited is a pioneer in the uniforms industry. Recognizing the importance of well-turned out staff, uniforms unlimited has been making finely-cut and well-stitched uniforms for over 25 years. Today, we are one of the leading uniform designers and manufactures in India. Over the years, exceptional customer service, innovative styles, unmatched comfort and durability have become our trademarks. We have achieved recognition and appreciation from one and all. Continuous research, innovation and up-gradation is a part of the process. Hence we not only manufacture but design, develop, create and innovate too. Over three decades of providing uniforms to the best in every industry, has given us the edge, of having hands on knowledge and expertise that cannot be substituted by anything else. Through intense research, we came up with innovative fabrics and techniques, like the use of heat resistant fabrics that absorb sweat, ventilation techniques etc that became the first designs for “chefs unlimited”. Today every designer and craftsman in the field follows our mandate. With focus on quality and consistency, we design, develop and create work wear for chefs, who take pride in their profession. Our chef-wear, is finely designed and cleverly crafted to suit the needs of any type of industrial kitchens. Customized chef wear designed and made for easy movement and comfort in kitchens, make us today the most sought after brands in the culinary world. We create the best styles according to the latest trends. While doing so they are balanced with practicality. Branded / mill made fabrics, buttons, threads, lining etc. Of the top most quality from reputed manufacturers are used for more durable uniforms. We ensure continuous innovation for improved products, be it in raw materials, fabrics or technology. It’s a matter of pride for most of the top chefs to get their chef coats tailor-made from us. Zubin is one such expert designer who believes ‘a stylish yet practical uniform enhances value and unifies the complete experience of hospitality’. He is a designer with a holistic approach blending richness in cultures and offers finely styled uniforms, which are practical as well as elaborate enough to bring instant connectivity with the destination where the hotels are located. Dezenzia emphasizes on the textures of fabrics used, the princess lines on the uniform, the subtle detail of the embroidery and pleats that turn a uniform into a couture garment. Dezenzia is uniforms limited’s designer collection studio. An optimum combination of creativity and sensibility it balances high-fashion with practicality. It’s the haute couture collection for businesses where impressions count. The power of customized designer uniforms in company’s branding cannot be under estimated. "Dezenzia” design studio boasts of a team of highly skilled and artistic “nift ians” who meticulously create the finest uniform designs that enhance the image of our clients to the highest of international standards. Dezenzia imbibes the value of a region/culture into design by repackaging the couture into finely styled garments that enhance the image of the client to the highest standards. Our endeavor has always been focused on amalgamating top style with highly practical attire. This is a huge challenge for fashion designers per say, but mr. Zubin having the thorough knowledge of uniforms and a state-of-art-facility to back his experience, can bring about this fusion with ease.

Inroduction We introduce ourselves as new, but fast growing manufacturing and processing unit of complete garments and other textile accessories and home furnishing items like throws and cushion covers. Vhitz fashions pvt. Ltd. Was established in the year 1950 as foundry unit in ambala city haryana India in the name and style krishna foundry works pvt. Ltd. Where we earned a name in foundry not for the quality but also for quantity and fare dealing. A step ahead now we have entered into the field of garment manufacturing by the name of vhitz fashions pvt. Ltd Products Our products are : Women’s wear Men’s wear Girl’s wear Baby wear Home furnishing throws cushion covers All the products are being manufactured acrylic Cotton woolen Blended yarns As may be required by customers and availability in the market Manufacturing The required yarn is purchased and tested, or supplied by the customer Yarn is knitted into a small piece called swatch is measured. Measured swatch is then washed and measured to observe shrinkage . Based on the observed shrinkage the final product is knitted, cutting, stitching washed and pressed and packed is ready for approval. After approval production is undertaken. During production the products is checked tested at every stage of manufacturing e.I.: 1. yarn purchase 2. knit swatch 3. washing of swatch 4. knitting fabricks 5. washing fabricks 6. stiching as per the requirement 7. linking 8. sewing 9. overlock 10.Kaaj button 11. Final inspection and packing List of machinery Computerized stoll flat bed knitting machines having knit width 72” and 96’’ in fine gauge and coarse gauge. stoll okc 420 3.5.2 4 stoll tc 340 6.2 2 stoll okc 502 3.5.2 3 stoll okc 420 7.2 2 Complete washing and pressing equipment required for the finishing of the products produced, Other machine include:- Number of machines Installed Linking machine 18 Sewing machine 30 Over lock machine 04 Folding 02 Kaaj and button 01 set Rewinding machine 2 Inspection table 20 Boiler 300 kgs Table press 05 Hand press 02 Complete washing equipment 2 set Finished products obtained after finishing is checked for quality before packing and dispatch Our team 1. aseem gupta: is an engineering graduate. Kkp group of companies is a pioneering innovative sustainable textile manufacturer, striving to deliver excellence and value optimizing technology. Our state-of-the-art vertically integrated manufacturing model is the strength that uniquely allows us to consistently outperform our peers, and provide the best-in-class range of products using the most non-destructive practices thereby ensuring the preservation of our planet earth. Above all, we proudly identify ourselves with an illustrious legacy of over four decades of unrelenting commitment to ‘business ethics’ as our most fundamental guiding principle. Today, kkp is fast accelerating to achieving the milestone of 1,000 crores of turn over per annum. In doing this, it has created direct and indirect employment opportunities for over 13,000 people, including a predominant number of women, resulting in tremendous social upliftment amongst the local communities. Under the able direction of its second-generation leadership, kkp continues its legacy of promoting community development through investments into the social areas of education, skilling, sports and health. Moreover, kkp has also got the agenda of a sustainable future and earth conservation at the forefront of its business and operations. It is significantly contributing to the green impact through adoption of planet friendly materials, processes and technologies.
